description: When i opened the app it is coming no games found
MY SOUNDS ARE ON EVERYTHING I RUN ON THIS APP - AND THERE'S WAY TO FIX / RESTORE ANYTHING

Right after you install it and try to run games it always says that the platform isn't supported yet but will be in future. The bummer is after digging around on the wiki I found out that libretro cores need to be installed in order to run games. One core for each platform after installing these Cores supported platforms just worked fine. You can install the libretro cores like this in the terminal: sudo apt-get install libretro-Corename. There should be an option to install those as plugin or come installed with the application right from the start.
OK for games player.

This program is riddled with so many issues. For starters, installing the program sometimes crashes. Using different Linux distros give different results even though it's using the same version! I'll install a libretro plugin for a game and it will never work. Always an error saying it doesn't support X feature yet. Still gave me the same problems in version 3.26 even though lots of people were saying "oh yes this feature works!" but it doesn't. Very finicky. I also can't select which directory to search for games in. I've sometimes opened this application to have it find every single game on my system and another time where it absolutely does not. It's a real shame because this is a very great concept for an application to have full integration but I still haven't received that.

Pro - it finds the games where ever you put them
Con - runs nothing...
summary: Finds the games, but doesn't run them. Support is coming?

description: I just have an issue with the theme that is displaying. I have Materia theme but the app is just using the default adwaita theme.

Very easy to use (except choosing a custom games folder, which required a bit of googling. TLDR: settings -> search -> Files -> gear button -> Other -> add your folder).

I love the concept of keeping a games collection and being able to run them with a simple double click. I play games for different platforms (PSX, GameBoy, snes, genesis), with and without gamepad, and it works like a charm.

Some suggested improvements:
 - Make it easy to export/import saved games
 - Document how to add a custom folder
 - Moar platforms!

description: Was able to find and load games. After configuring a Nintendo Switch Pro controller to work with Linux, it successfully detected it the first time; however, it kept losing my button mappings.
